intro: Coniogramme robusta var. robusta, commonly known as the robust coniogramme, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in compound umbels, which are typically borne on long, slender peduncles. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. The leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
